page.title: 01North Frodingham with Foston
page.content: A flat lowland area averaging only 25 feet above sea level. It is intensively farmed mainly with cereal and oilseed rape crops. A few beef and dairy cattle and sheep are kept. Farms are predominantly 100-200 acres in extent and are owner-occupied. The area is noted for intensive pig and turkey rearing in enclosed factory units. North Frodingham is an ancient rural linear settlement with a lively community enjoying a good standard of social amenities. There is a significant proportion of young families, many living in modern private housing. The employment level is high although many people travel by car to neighbouring centres to work. Foston is a small rural settlement with few amenities.
